description: Those looking to complete the CompTIA A+ 900 Series certification will find in this course an overview of the process in achieving the certification and details about the two exams required to pass in order to receive the certification. The certification is designed for entry level IT professionals with about a year of experience. Some of the exam objectives include hardware, networking, mobile devices, operating systems, security, and troubleshooting, making it a valuable certification to have especially for one just getting in to the IT career field with no documented experience.
descriptionMD: Those looking to complete the CompTIA A+ 900 Series certification will find in this course an overview of the process in achieving the certification and details about the two exams required to pass in order to receive the certification. The certification is designed for entry level IT professionals with about a year of experience. Some of the exam objectives include hardware, networking, mobile devices, operating systems, security, and troubleshooting, making it a valuable certification to have especially for one just getting in to the IT career field with no documented experience.__This course has been CAQC'd and qualifies for CEU credits. [Click here](https://itpro.tv/comptia-partnership) to get an exam voucher discount.__
name: CompTIA A+ (220-901)
subtitle: Vendor-neutral hardware and software technologies

episodes.description: Those looking to complete the CompTIA A+ 900 Series certification will find in this course an overview of the process in achieving the certification and details about the two exams required to pass in order to receive the certification. The certification is designed for entry level IT professionals with about a year of experience. Some of the exam objectives include hardware, networking, mobile devices, operating systems, security, and troubleshooting, making it a valuable certification to have especially for one just getting in to the IT career field with no documented experience.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss using BIOS/UEFI tools on a PC, a history of BIOS & UEFI, overview of BIOS component information, BIOS configurations, how to set date & time, how to re-configure settings in BIOS, virtualization support, BIOS security, what LoJack is, monitoring, and built in diagnostics.
episodes.title: Configure BIOS and UEFI Settings

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Mike begin their exploration of various components typically found on a motherboard. They talk about integrated versus non-integrated components, buses, the CMOS battery, expansion slots, and the Northbridge and Southbridge chipsets.
episodes.title: Motherboard Components

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Mike continue to look at common components of a motherboard. They discuss power connectors for the motherboard, storage, and the CPU. They also look at fan connectors, as well as front/top panel connectors.
episodes.title: Motherboard Components Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Wes and Mike break down the different form factors of motherboards. They discuss how size is not the only difference between the form-factors. They also look at the different expansion slots and their bandwidth.
episodes.title: Motherboard Components Part 3

episodes.description: Wes and Zach compare and contrast various RAM types and their features, RAM vs. ROM defining what each are, ECC vs. non-ECC explaining what each are, Parity vs. non-Parity, what buffered & non-buffered mean, single channel vs. dual & triple channel, and RAM configurations.
episodes.title: RAM Types and Features

episodes.description: Wes and Zach continue discussing RAM types, definitions of DDR-DDR2-DDR3-SODIMM-DIMM, ROM types including PROM-EPROM-EEPROM, and the complexities of combining different RAM in the same system.
episodes.title: RAM Types and Features Part 2

episodes.description: Wes and Zach discuss what Expansion Cards are, where to install cards, integrated vs. non-integrated,  how to choose the correct cards for your device, sound & video cards, network cards, Firewire cards, what Thunderbolt cards are, storage cards, adding additional USB ports, USB-Type-A & USB-Type-C, what Riser Cards are, TV Tuner cards, Modem cards, Drivers, Motherboard considerations, case-tower considerations, and power supply considerations.
episodes.title: PC Expansion Cards

episodes.description: Wes and Zach begin the discussion of how to install and configure storage devices, use of appropriate media, optical drives, CD-ROM/CD-RW, DVD-ROM/DVD-RW/DVD-RW DL, DVDDL, Blu-Ray, BD-R, BD-RE, and file system for CDFS & UDF.
episodes.title: Install and Configure Storage Devices

episodes.description: Wes and Zach continue the discussion of how to install and configure storage devices, 'magnetic hard disk drives' & the various rpm (5400-7200-10,000), 'hot swapable drive' vs. a 'cold swappable drive' & 'warm swappable drive,' solid state/flash drives, compact flash types-SD, MicroSD, MiniSD, xD, SSD, Hybrid, eMMC, and what a tape drive is including LTO tape.
episodes.title: Install and Configure Storage Devices Part 2

episodes.description: Wes and Zach conclude the discussion of how to install and configure storage devices, more discussion on flash drives with an overview of what a 'Hybrid' drive is, what are RAID types- type 0 (block level striping), type 1 (mirror), type 5 (parody bit & redundancy with striping), and type 10 (nested raid).
episodes.title: Install and Configure Storage Devices Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore installing various types of CPUs and apply the appropriate cooling methods. Specific topics covered here includes: CPU socket types and CPU characteristics like speeds, cores, cache, hyperthreading, virtualization support, and architecture.
episodes.title: CPUs and Appropriate Cooling

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore installing various types of CPUs and apply the appropriate cooling methods. Specific topics covered here includes: Cooling solutions like heat sinks, fans, thermal paste, liquid cooling, and fanless/passive solutions.
episodes.title: CPUs and Appropriate Cooling Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes begin the vast conversation that is PC connections and characteristics. Specific topics covered here includes: Universal Serial Bus(USB) and Firewire 1394.
episodes.title: PC Connections and Characteristics

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes begin the vast conversation that is PC connections and characteristics. Specific topics covered here includes: Serial ATA(SATA), VGA, Digital Video Interface(DVI), High Definition Multi-Media Interface(HDMI), Tipped Ring Sleeve(TRS), Sony/Phillips Digital Interface(SPDIF), Display Port, and Thunderbolt.
episodes.title: PC Connections and Characteristics Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes begin the vast conversation that is PC connections and characteristics. Specific topics covered here includes: Composite/RCA, Component/RGB, Bluetooth, Infrared(IR), Near Field Communications(NFC), and Adapters like DVI-to-VGA, Thunderbolt-to-DVI, HDMI-to-VGA, etc.
episodes.title: PC Connections and Characteristics Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Wes explore installing a power supply based on given specifications. Specific topics covered include: Connector types and their voltages, Wattage, Form Factor, Molex types, voltage options, etc...
episodes.title: Power Supplies

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore building custom PCs as called out in the A+ 220-901 exam. Here they will walk you through choosing the correct CPU, Memory, Network adapter(s), and storage required for PC types like Graphics/CAD/CAM, Virtualization, Gaming, Home Server, and thick/thin client workstations.
episodes.title: Custom PCs

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes compare and contrast types of display devices and their features. Specific topics covered includes: Cathode Ray Tube(CRT) monitors, Liquid Crystal Display(LCD), Refresh/Frame rates, screen resolutions, multi-monitor support, aspect ratios, and analog vs. digital.
episodes.title: Display Devices

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes install and configure common peripheral devices. Specific topics covered includes: Scanners, keyboards, mice, barcode scanners, biometric scanners, gamepads, motion scanners, touchpads, smartcard readers, digital cameras, web cam, printers, display devices, touchscreens, etc.
episodes.title: Common Peripheral Devices

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explain the details about SOHO Multi-Function Devices(MFD) and Printers. Specific topics covered includes: printer drivers (PPD/PCL/UPD), configuration settings, device sharing using wired media, wireless (802.11x), ethernet, bluetooth, NFC, and Integrated Print Servers.
episodes.title: SOHO, MFDs and Printers

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes walk you through each of the printer types found in the A+ 220-901 exam. Here you will learn about the components and printing processes of Laser printers, Inkjet printers, Thermal printers, Impact printers, and Virtual printers.
episodes.title: Printer Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Zach explore some of the common printer maintenance techniques, and look at the tools & utilities used for various printer technologies.
episodes.title: Printer Maintenance

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes help you identify the various types of network cables and connectors specific to the A+ exam. Specific topics covered here includes: Fiber Optic media and connectors like Single-Mode and Multi-Mode, SC/ST/LC as well as Copper media and connectors like Twisted-Pair (UTP/STP), Plenum, CAT3/5/6/7, RJ-45, and Coax.
episodes.title: Network Cables and Connectors

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explain the properties and characteristics of TCP/IP. Specific topics covered include: IPv4 vs. IPv6, Public vs. Private vs. APIPA, Static vs. Dynamic addressing, Client-side DNS settings, Client-side DHCP, Subnet Masks, CIDR, and Gateways.
episodes.title: TCP/IP Characteristics

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explain the properties and characteristics of TCP/IP. Specific topics covered include: IPv4 vs. IPv6, Public vs. Private vs. APIPA, Static vs. Dynamic addressing, Client-side DNS settings, Client-side DHCP, Subnet Masks, CIDR, and Gateways.
episodes.title: TCP/IP Characteristics Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explain the properties and characteristics of TCP/IP. Specific topics covered include: IPv4 vs. IPv6, Public vs. Private vs. APIPA, Static vs. Dynamic addressing, Client-side DNS settings, Client-side DHCP, Subnet Masks, CIDR, and Gateways.
episodes.title: TCP/IP Characteristics Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explain the properties and characteristics of TCP/IP. Specific topics covered include: IPv4 vs. IPv6, Public vs. Private vs. APIPA, Static vs. Dynamic addressing, Client-side DNS settings, Client-side DHCP, Subnet Masks, CIDR, and Gateways.
episodes.title: TCP/IP Characteristics Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explain the properties and characteristics of TCP/IP. Specific topics covered include: IPv4 vs. IPv6, Public vs. Private vs. APIPA, Static vs. Dynamic addressing, Client-side DNS settings, Client-side DHCP, Subnet Masks, CIDR, and Gateways.
episodes.title: TCP/IP Characteristics Part 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explain common TCP and UDP ports, protocols, and their purpose. Specific ports and protocols covered includes: FTP, SSH, TELNET, SMTP, DNS, HTTP(S), POP3, IMAP, RDP, NetBIOS, SMB/CIFS, SLP, AFP, DHCP, and LDAP.
episodes.title: Common Ports and Protocols

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes compare and contrast the various WiFi networking standards and encryption types. Specific topics covered includes: 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, Speeds, distances, and frequencies, WEP, WPA, WPA2, TKIP, and AES.
episodes.title: WiFi Standards and Encryption

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore the relevant information with regards to installing and configuring a SOHO wireless/wired router and applying appropriate settings. Specific topics discussed includes: Channels, Frequencies, Port Forwarding, Port Triggering, DCHP, DMZ, NAT/DNAT, QoS, Firmware, and UPnP.
episodes.title: Install SOHO Wireless/Wired Router

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes compare and contrast different internet connection types, network types, and their features. Specific types covered here includes: Cable, DSL, Dial-up, Fiber, Satellite, ISDN, Cellular, Tethering, Mobile Hotspots, Line-of-Sight, LANs, WANs, PANs, and MANs.
episodes.title: Internet Connections and Network Types

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes compare and contrast different internet connection types, network types, and their features. Specific types covered here includes: Cable, DSL, Dial-up, Fiber, Satellite, ISDN, Cellular, Tethering, Mobile Hotspots, Line-of-Sight, LANs, WANs, PANs, and MANs.
episodes.title: Internet Connections and Network Types Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes compare and contrast network architecture devices as well as their functions and features. Specific topics covered include: Hubs, Switches, Routers, Access Points(APs), Bridges, Modems, Firewalls, Patch Panels, Repeaters/Extenders, Ethernet over Power(EoP), and Power over Ethernet(PoE).
episodes.title: Network Architecture Devices

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes look over, install, and configure the common hardware and expansion components found in laptop computers. Here specifically they explore: battery life, thermal management, expansion options (like ports, cards, and dongles), internal storage types,
episodes.title: Laptop Hardware and Components

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes look over, install, and configure the common hardware and expansion components found in laptop computers. Here specifically they explore: special function keys (fn keys), docking stations, physical and cable locks, and screens.
episodes.title: Laptop Hardware and Components Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes look over, install, and configure the common hardware and expansion components found in laptop computers. Here specifically they explore: hardware components like memory, hard drives, DC jacks, touchpads, speakers, web cams, cooling systems, wireless devices, and other laptop internals.
episodes.title: Laptop Hardware and Components Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes cover the common features found in mobile devices like tablets, smartphones, and laptops. Specific topics covered here includes: CPU Characteristics, smart watches, fitness monitors, glasses, headsets, phablets, e-readers, smart cameras, GPS, and different connection types.
episodes.title: Mobile Devices

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Wes troubleshoot common problems related to motherboards, RAM, CPU, and power with appropriate tools. Specific topics covered here includes: motherboard malfunction symptoms like burning smells, smoke, unexpected shutdowns, system lockups, and POST beeps.
episodes.title: Common Mobo, RAM, CPU and Power Issues

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes troubleshoot common problems related to motherboards, RAM, CPU, and power with appropriate tools. Specific topics covered here includes: POST beeps, BIOS settings and/or time resets, trying to boot to incorrect device, no power to system or devices, noises, indicator lights, and proprietary screen crashes (e.g. BSOD).
episodes.title: Motherboard, RAM, CPU and Power Issues Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes troubleshoot common problems related to motherboards, RAM, CPU, and power with appropriate tools. Specific topics covered here includes: demonstration of dead CMOS battery, POST Card demo, and testing for a bad power supply.
episodes.title: Motherboard, RAM, CPU and Power Issues Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes look at troubleshooting hard drives and RAID arrays with appropriate tools. Specific topics covered here includes: Read/Write failures, Slow Performance, CHKDSK, Disk Defrag, and Loud Clicking noises.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Hard Drives and RAID Arrays

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes look at troubleshooting hard drives and RAID arrays with appropriate tools. Specific topics covered here includes: Fail to boot, OS not found, FixMBR, FixBoot, BootRec utility, bcdedit, Drive not recognized, and SMART errors.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Hard Drives and RAID Arrays Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes look at troubleshooting hard drives and RAID arrays with appropriate tools. Specific topics covered here includes: RAID not found, RAID stops working, screwdrivers,
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Hard Drives and RAID Arrays Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes troubleshoot common video, projector, and display issues. Specific topics covered here includes: VGA mode, no image, overheat shutdown, dead pixels, artifacts, incorrect color patterns, dim images, flickering image, distorted image, burn-in, and oversized images/icons.
episodes.title: Common Video, Projector and Display Issues

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes troubleshoot both wired and wireless networks with appropriate tools. Specific topics covered here include: Connectivity issues, disconnected cables, dead ports, dead devices, power loss, misconfiguration, incorrect cable standards, and device drivers.
episodes.title: Common Wired/Wireless Network Issues

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes troubleshoot both wired and wireless networks with appropriate tools. Specific topics covered here include: Wireless Connectivity issues (proximity/frequency mismatch/standards mismatch/security settings/pass key mismatch), APIPA, failing devices, limited connectivity, ping, and IP conflicts.
episodes.title: Common Wired/Wireless Network Issues Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes troubleshoot both wired and wireless networks with appropriate tools. Specific topics covered here include: slow transfer speeds, low RF signal, SSID not found, hardware tools, and command line tools like tracert, netstat, and nslookup.
episodes.title: Common Wired/Wireless Network Issues Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore troubleshooting and repairing common mobile device issues while adhering to appropriate procedures. Specific topics covered here includes: Field Serviceable vs. Non-Field Serviceable, display issues, sticking keys, battery not charging/power issues, ghost cursor/pointer drift, and intermittent/no wireless connectivity.
episodes.title: Common Mobile Device Issues

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explore troubleshooting and repairing common mobile device issues while adhering to appropriate procedures. Specific topics covered here includes: Bluetooth connectivity, can't display to external monitor, non-responsive touchscreen, apps not loading, slow performance, can't decrypt email, short battery life, overheating, no sound, gps malfunction, swollen battery, and disassembly/reassembly procedures.
episodes.title: Common Mobile Device Issues Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes take a look at troubleshooting printers with appropriate tools. Here they will cover specific printer symptoms like: streaks, faded prints, toner not fused to paper, creased paper, paper not feeding, paper jams, no connectivity to printer, garbled characters, vertical lines on page, backed up print queue, low memory errors, access denied errors, printer will not print or prints wrong color, unable to install printer, error codes, printing blank pages, no image on printer display, and the tools used in printer maintenance.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Printers
